definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The orchid's only in bloom for one more week, tops.
sentences.chinese: 那种兰花最多只能再开一周。

sentences.english: They are thinking to open another Lucky Express in this street.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算在这条街上再开一家乐凯快印店。

sentences.english: I take the next left turn to the stop sign.
sentences.chinese: 我在下个路口左转弯，到一个停车再开标志处。

sentences.english: The only time any peripherals go on is when I use them, too, like the printer.
sentences.chinese: 外设什么的用的时候再开，比如打印机。

sentences.english: She bought several clothes shops and prepared to build up a chain.
sentences.chinese: 她盘下了几家服装店，并且打算再开一家新的分店。

definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to break up/to divide property and live apart/to start on a new (path)
to get over (a shock, bereavement etc)/to avoid dwelling on unpleasant things/to accept the situation and move on
to reissue/(of a disease) to recur/(of a patient) to suffer a relapse
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
to connect (a cable etc)/to hook up (a device)/to resume (a conversation)/to set (a bone)
to open a business/first transaction of a business day

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
